item.title: [PI] NPC taking multiple items
item.dc:creator: @enahsh2o enahsh2o
item.description:
@enahsh2o wrote:

Sorry if the title doesn’t make much sense, but was the best I could come up with to explain the problem in the title.
So, I am making a quest and during the quest you have to give the NPC 2 items, 1000 of 1 and 1 of the other. But I am getting an error when trying to put this in. Here is what the code looks like:

case 536:
			if (c.aProMinerStatus == 5) {
				c.getDH().sendPlayerChat2(9830, "Hello Nurmof!",
						"I am back with the things you asked for.");
				if (c.getItems().playerHasItem(2358, 1000)) 
					(c.getItems().playerHasItem(15259)) {
					c.nextChat = 537;
				} else {
					c.nextChat = 517;
				}
			} else {
				c.getDH().sendPlayerChat1(9830,
						"Woops! Forgot my items.");
				c.nextChat = 512;
			}
			break;

Here is where I am getting the error:

					(c.getItems().playerHasItem(15259)) {

“(c.getItems().playerHasItem(15259)) {” is where the error comes in on Eclipse.
Here is what the error says:
“Syntax error on token(s), misplaced construct(s)”

From the sounds of it, it is a simple problem of being written wrong. But I can’t figure out how to write it right. Sorry for my dumbness. Thank you for any help in advance!

EDIT: Not sure if this matters, but it is in DialogueHandler.java. And if you need any more pieces of code let me know and I will try to post it.

Read full topic
